newsitem.title: UK: No plans to put Czech Republic on watch -IBCA.
newsitem.headline: No plans to put Czech Republic on watch -IBCA.

text.p: IBCA, the European rating agency, said on Friday it had no plans at present to put the Czech Republic on its watch list.
"We do not have a plan to put it on RatingWatch at the moment," said Paul Rawkins, senior economist at IBCA in London.
IBCA assigned a long-term rating of A minus in August 1995 to the Czech Republic, Rawkins said.
"We are going to review the rating in the next few months. We do not make a rating change without a visit," Rawkins said.
The Czech National Bank was forced to intervene on Friday to support the falling crown, for the fourth time in the last week.
"The government is doing the right things," said Rawkins.
"But if it is going to hang onto this exchange rate, interest rates are going to remain higher than they should be."
